timeline.message:
MINOR: Add ApiMessageTypeGenerator

Previously, we had some code hard-coded to generate message type classes
for RPCs.  We might want to generate message type classes for other
things as well, so make it more generic.

timeline.bodyText: Generate the type and write it out to the internal state.
timeline.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: I thought about that, but it doesn't really make anything simpler.  If there's no typeclass, we don't want to add an output file, we don't want to write to it, etc. etc.  So we still need all the same logic.
replies.author: cmccabe

timeline.bodyText: Why we need separate exit code for mis-used arguments?
timeline.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: It's traditional for invoking a program with no arguments to print out the usage message, and exit with success, which is 0.  If there was a usage error, then we exit with failure, which is 1.
replies.author: cmccabe

timeline.bodyText: Why we remove the counter here? Actually my q is whether this is correct behavior before.
timeline.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: The counter is used to output how many JSON files we processed in the printf down below. Since this doesn't process a JSON file, yes it was incorrect.
replies.author: cmccabe
